alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 02 at 7:05PM MST until September 02 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 659 PM MST, Thunderstorms have ended for now with only light showers in the area. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Russell Wash, Bull Run Creek, Beaver Creek, Gap Creek, West Clear Creek, Little Sycamore Creek, Dry Creek, Cherry Creek, Verde River, Spring Creek, Oak Wash, Bitter Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Blowout Creek, Gaddis Wash, Little Ash Creek, Grief Hill Wash, Chasm Creek, Cienega Creek, Oak Creek and Coffee Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarkdale, Cottonwood and Middle Verde. - This includes the following swimming holes... Mormons Crossing and West Clear Creek near the campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 232. Interstate 17 between mile markers 283 and 294. State Route 89A between mile markers 350 and 365. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
